intro: Andropogon ischaemum var. radicans, commonly known as匍匐狗尾草, is a perennial grass species native to North America. It is characterized by its low-growing, spreading habit with rhizomes that allow it to form dense mats. The plant produces fluffy, cylindrical seed heads that are typical of the grass family Poaceae. It thrives in a variety of soil types and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities and a useful plant for erosion control.
